rules.natural: If Region1 maintains traditional methods for cheese, then Region1 produces high-quality cheese.
Provided that Region1 follows a protected recipe for cheese, aged properly occurs for cheese in Region1.
Either Region1 follows a protected recipe for cheese or Region1 uses local ingredients for cheese.
Assuming Region1 uses local ingredients for cheese, whenever cheese production is not successful in Region1, Region1 maintains traditional methods for cheese.
If Region1's cheese is inspected by the association, then Region1 passes the quality check for cheese.
Region1's cheese is inspected by the association or Region1's cheese is tested in a lab.

Supposing that Region1's cheese is tested in a lab, under the condition that Region1 ages cheese properly, if cheese production is not successful in Region1, Region1 maintains traditional methods for cheese.
Whenever Region1's cheese receives protected status, cheese production is successful in Region1.
Either Region1's cheese receives protected status or Region1's cheese meets production standards.
If Region1's cheese meets production standards, then Region1 follows geographical rules for cheese.
Assuming Region1's cheese has regional recognition, if Region1 follows geographical rules for cheese, then cheese production is successful in Region1.
Provided that Region1's cheese is sold at markets, Region1's cheese is featured in restaurants.
Either Region1's cheese is sold at markets or Region1's cheese is distributed to shops.
Supposing that Region1's cheese is distributed to shops, if Region1 does not have a suitable climate, then Region1 requires import of cheese.
Whenever Region1's cheese is featured in restaurants, Region1's cheese is used by local chefs.
Provided that local cheese is preferred in Region1, imported cheese is not preferred in Region1.
If Region1's cheese needs government support, then Region1's cheese faces production challenges.

Assuming Region1 applies for subsidies for cheese, if it is not the case that following geographical rules for cheese implies successful cheese production in Region1, then Region1's cheese needs government support.

Given that Region1 seeks investment for cheese, if it is not the case that following geographical rules for cheese implies successful cheese production in Region1, then Region1's cheese needs government support.
If Region1 receives funding for cheese, then Region1's cheese production is sustainable.

Under the condition that Region1 has a suitable climate, if it is not true that having protected designation certification implies not having organic certification, then Region1 is not approved for export.

Provided that it is not the case that following geographical rules for cheese implies successful cheese production in Region1, Region1's cheese does not face production challenges.
